record_data.record_title: Revised Allegheny Power Market Based Rate Tariff
record_data.record_narrative_name: Revised Allegheny Power Market Based Rate Tariff
record_data.record_plain_text:
ALLEGHENY POWER MARKET RATE TARIFF
1. Availability. Allegheny Power (“AP”) will make available electric energy and/or capacity under this Market Rate Tariff for sales to purchasers with whom Allegheny Power has contracted. Allegheny Power also makes the following ancillary services available to any purchaser, except as prohibited below:
a. PJM: Allegheny Power offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10- minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. (“PJM”) and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection.
2. Applicability. This Market Rate Tariff is applicable to all sales of electric energy, capacity and ancillary services by Allegheny Power not otherwise subject to a specific rate schedule or tariff.
3. Rates. All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Allegheny Power.
4. Other Terms and Conditions. All other terms and conditions of sale shall be established by agreement between purchaser and Allegheny Power.
5. Compliance with Commission Regulations: AP shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Par 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning AP’s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes AP to engage in affiliate sales under this Market Rate Tariff or otherwise restricts or limits AP’s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning AP’s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this Market Rate Tariff.
6. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: Other than as specified herein, AP has not been granted any waivers or exemptions in connection with its market-based rate authority. Sales of energy and/or capacity shall be made pursuant to the Commission’s regulations. Accordingly, Allegheny Power will make the same offer at the same time to non-affiliated companies and will simultaneously post via an electronic bulletin board the actual price charged to its affiliates for all transactions. Sales to affiliates shall not be made at a rate lower than the rate charges to non-affiliates. See Allegheny Power Serv. Corp., 82 FERC ¶61,245 (1998). The Allegheny Power operating companies (Monongahela Power Company, The Potomac Edison Company and West Penn Power Company) may make hourly non-firm energy sales to one another at the PJM index price for the Allegheny Power transmission zone of PJM. See Allegheny Power Serv. Corp., 90 FERC ¶61,002 (2000). Monongahela Power Company has been granted the following waiver in connection with its market-based rate authority: waiver of the separation of functions requirements of Section 35.39(c)(2)(i) of the Commission’s regulations (18 C.F.R. § 35.39(c)(2)(i)) to permit FirstEnergy Service Company employees to prepare and submit offers into the PJM Reliability Pricing Model capacity auctions for both Monongahela Power Company and Allegheny Energy Supply Company, LLC’s entitlements to Ohio Valley Electric Corporation capacity. See FirstEnergy Serv. Co., 181 FERC ¶ 61,201 (2022).
7. Seller Category. AP is a Category 1 Seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a), in the Central, Northwest, Southeast and Southwest Regions and in the Southwest Power Pool. AP is a Category 2 seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. § 35.36(a), in the Northeast Region.
8. Effective Date. This Market Rate Tariff is effective upon the date specified by the Commission.
FORM OF SERVICE AGREEMENT
This Agreement is entered into this day of , , by and among (“Buyer”) and Monongahela Power Company, The Potomac Edison Company and West Penn Power Company (collectively, “Allegheny Power”), in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements herein, Buyer and Allegheny Power (the “Party(ies)”) hereby agree as follows: Article 1. Service.
1.1 Allegheny Power agrees, during the term of this Agreement, to sell electric energy and/or capacity to Buyer and Buyer agrees to pay for such sale in accordance with Allegheny Power’s Market Rate Tariff Electric Rate Schedule No. 1 (“Market Rate Tariff”) on file with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (“FERC”).
1.2 The terms and conditions of such service shall be (1) governed by the Market Rate Tariff, as it exists at the time of this Agreement or as subsequently amended, and (2) separately negotiated and agreed to by the Parties, with respect to sales of capacity and/or energy to a Buyer under this Market Rate Tariff.
1.3 In executing this Agreement, neither Allegheny Power nor Buyer commits to enter into any individual sales of capacity and/or energy to a Buyer under this Market Rate Tariff.
Article 2. Effective Date and Term of Agreement.
2.1 This Agreement shall become effective on the date first stated above. However, if the FERC or any reviewing court imposes any condition, limitation, or qualification under any of the provisions of the Federal Power Act which, individually or in the aggregate, Allegheny Power determines to be adverse to Allegheny Power, the Allegheny Power may at its option, terminate or renegotiate the terms of this Agreement in light of such FERC order or court action. Each party will use its best efforts to take, or cause to be taken, all actions requisite to obtain the necessary approvals so that this Agreement shall become effective as provided herein at the earliest practicable date.
2.2 This Agreement shall remain effective until terminated by either Party on thirty (30) days written notice.
Article 3. Notice. 3.1 Any notice given pursuant to this Agreement or the Market Rate Tariff shall be in writing and delivered to the following:
If to Allegheny Power:
President Allegheny Power 800 Cabin Hill Drive Greensburg, PA 15601
If to Buyer:
______________________________
3.2 The names and addresses for notice either Party may be changed at any time by written notice to the other Party.
3.2 Other terms and conditions
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have caused this Agreement to be executed by their respective authorized officials as of the date first above written.
BUYER Monongahela Power Company The Potomac Edison Company West Penn Power Company
By: By:
Name: Name:
Title: Title:
